intro: Heteropterys bullata, commonly known as the bullate hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
